metadata.title: USN-6947-1 -- Kerberos vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled GSS message tokens where an unwrapped token could appear to be truncated. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2024-37370)  It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled GSS message tokens when sent a token with invalid length fields. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2024-37371)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6947-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  krb5-admin-server - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-doc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-gss-samples - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-k5tls - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-kdc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-kpropd - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-locales - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-multidev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-otp - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-pkinit - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 krb5-user - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libgssrpc4 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libk5crypto3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkdb5-9 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkrad-dev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkrad0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkrb5-3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkrb5-dev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 libkrb5support0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
